batterychargermain-faulty.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002 @mainpage Solar Regulator Project Embedded Atmel AVR module
00003 @version 0.0.1
00004 @author Ken Sarkies (www.jiggerjuice.net)
00005 @date 30 October 2009
00006 @brief Code for the embedded portion of the Solar Regulator Project,
00007 for the Atmel MCU ATMega88 or ATMega168
00008 
00009 This is a test version to check battery operation.
00010 
00011 @note
00012 Software: AVR-GCC 1:4.2.2-1
00013 @note
00014 Target:   ATMega AVR with UART, I2C and ADC functions
00015 @note
00016 Tested:   ATMega48, ATMega88, ATMega168 at 8MHz, using UART, TWI, ADC.
00017 @note
00018 Uses:     UART library of Peter Fleury, NARTOS scheduling operating system
00019           library, TWI library, ADC library, Timer library.
00020  */

00060 #define TRUE 1
00061 #define FALSE 0
00062 /* Convenience macros (we don't use them all) */
00063 #define  _BV(bit) (1 << (bit))
00064 #define  inb(sfr) _SFR_BYTE(sfr)
00065 #define  inw(sfr) _SFR_WORD(sfr)
00066 #define  outb(sfr, val) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) = (val))
00067 #define  outw(sfr, val) (_SFR_WORD(sfr) = (val))
00068 #define  cbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) &= ~_BV(bit))
00069 #define  sbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) |= _BV(bit))
00070 #define  high(x) ((uint8_t) (x >> 8) & 0xFF)
00071 #define  low(x) ((uint8_t) (x & 0xFF))

00079 volatile union timeUnion
00080 {
00081     volatile uint32_t timeValue;
00082     volatile uint8_t  timeByte[4];
00083 } time;

00093     volatile uint16_t controlInterval = 0;
00094     volatile uint16_t saveDelayCounter = 0;
00095     volatile uint16_t displayDelayCounter = 0;

00097     volatile uint16_t displayInterval = 0;

00105     volatile uint8_t lastError;    
00106     volatile uint8_t checkSum;     
00110     volatile uint8_t packetInState;   
00111     volatile uint8_t numberInBytes;   
00112     volatile uint8_t dataInByteCount; 
00113     volatile uint8_t inputCommand;    
00114     volatile uint8_t inputBuffer[DATA_BUFFER_SIZE]; 
00118     volatile uint8_t outputBusy;      
00119     volatile uint8_t packetOutState;  
00120     volatile uint8_t numberOutBytes;  
00121     volatile uint8_t dataOutByteCount;
00122     volatile uint8_t outputCommand;   
00123     volatile uint8_t outputBuffer[DATA_BUFFER_SIZE]; 
00127     volatile uint8_t inputPacketReceiveID;
00128     volatile uint8_t outputPacketSendID;
00129     volatile uint8_t processCommandID;
00130     volatile uint8_t processErrorID;

00156 /****************************************************************************/
00159 int main(void)
00160 {
00162     wdt_disable();                  /* Stop watchdog timer */
00163     setErrorCode(0);                /* Turn off error messages */
00165     if (eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)0) == 0xFF)     /* If unprogrammed, use defaults */
00166     {
00167         rtcScale = RTC_SCALE;           /* Tick period for RTC */
00168         localEEPROMDevice = LOCAL_EEPROM_DEVICE;        /* Address of EEPROM on I2C bus */
00169         eepromEnd = EEPROM_END;     /* Last address of EEPROM */
00170     }
00171     else
00172     {
00173         rtcScale = eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)15);
00174         localEEPROMDevice = eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)14);
00175         eepromEnd = eeprom_read_word((uint16_t *)12);
00176     }
00177 
00179     configurePorts();
00180     openPanel();
00181     connectLoad();
00182     adcInit(ADC_MODE,ADC_SPEED);
00183     twiInit(TWI_SPEED);
00184     InitLCD(0x00);
00185     time.timeValue = 0;
00186     timer0Init(0,rtcScale);
00187 
00190     uart_init(BAUDRATE);
00191 
00193     sei();
00194 
00196     lastError = NO_ERROR;
00197     packetInState = IDLE;       /* state for packet input state machine */
00198     packetOutState = IDLE;      /* state for packet transmission state machine */
00199     outputCommand = NO_COMMAND; /* command for transmission */
00200     outputBusy = FALSE;
00201 
00204     initNartos();
00205     inputPacketReceiveID = taskStart((uint16_t)*inputPacketReceive,FALSE);
00206     initiateControlTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*initiateControlTask,FALSE);
00207     LCDClear();
00208     LCDWriteString("Solar Power");
00209     LCDGotoXY(0,1);                         /* Next Line */
00210     LCDWriteString("Regulator V0.0");
00211     nartos();
00212 }
00213 
00214 /****************************************************************************/
00223 void initiateControlTask(void)
00224 {
00230     while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00231     twiSetupTransaction(0x04);              /* Read Mode: 4 bytes of pointers */
00232     twiWriteByte(0x00);                     /* High address */
00233     twiWriteByte(0x08);                     /* Low address */
00234 /* Try to launch the read. If there is a problem, drop out */
00235     if(twiLaunch(localEEPROMDevice))        /* device ID */
00236     {
00237 /* The twiCompletionStatus shows if the transaction is busy and also how many
00238 bytes were read if an aborted transaction occurred. First wait until not busy.*/
00239         uint8_t twiAddressLow;
00240         while (twiCompletionStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00241         if (twiCompletionStatus() == 0)
00242         {
00243 /* Read backed up start and end pointers from the EEPROM */
00244             twiAddressLow = twiReadByte();
00245             uint16_t startPointer = twiAddressLow + (twiReadByte()<<8);
00246             twiAddressLow = twiReadByte();
00247             uint16_t endPointer = twiAddressLow + (twiReadByte()<<8);
00248             if ((startPointer < BUFFER_START) || (startPointer > eepromEnd)
00249                 || (endPointer < BUFFER_START) || (endPointer > eepromEnd))
00250             {
00251 /* If the backup buffer pointers are not OK, reset all of them to the start */
00252                 while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00253                 twiSetupTransaction(0);                 /* Write only */
00254                 twiWriteByte(0x00);                     /* High EEPROM address */
00255                 twiWriteByte(0x08);                     /* Low EEPROM address */
00256                 bufferStartPointer = BUFFER_START;
00257                 bufferEndPointer = bufferStartPointer;
00258                 twiWriteByte(low(bufferStartPointer));  /* Start Pointer */
00259                 twiWriteByte(high(bufferStartPointer));
00260                 twiWriteByte(low(bufferEndPointer));    /* End Pointer */
00261                 twiWriteByte(high(bufferEndPointer));
00262                 if (twiLaunch(localEEPROMDevice))       /* device number */
00263                 {
00264                     while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00265                     uint8_t lastTwiError = twiErrorStatus();
00266                     if (lastTwiError != 0) setErrorCode(WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL);
00267                 }
00268                 else
00269                     setErrorCode(WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL);
00270             }
00271             else                                        /* reset pointers to end of buffer */
00272             {
00273 /* If the backup pointers are OK, set the current pointers to the backup end pointer */
00274                 bufferStartPointer = endPointer;
00275                 bufferEndPointer = bufferStartPointer;
00276             }
00277         }
00278         else
00279         setErrorCode(READ_EEPROM_FAIL);
00280     }
00281     else
00282         setErrorCode(READ_EEPROM_FAIL);
00283 /* Set some defaults that will be parameters later */
00284     adcShift = 5;
00285 /* The display task runs at intervals restarted by the timer ISR.*/
00286     saveDelayCounter = 0;
00287     displayInterval = 60;                   /* 1s ticks of display task */
00288     displayTaskCounter = displayInterval;
00289     displayTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*displayTask,FALSE);
00290 /* The control task runs permanently. */
00291     controlDelayCounter = 0;
00292     controlInterval = 120;
00293     controlTaskCounter = controlInterval;
00294     controlTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*controlTask,FALSE);
00295     taskExit();
00296 }
00297 
00298 /****************************************************************************/
00308 void measurementTask(void)
00309 {
00310 /* Check that all channels are defined and get the necessary scale factors.
00311 This needs to happen regularly in case the EEPROM data is changed, so we do
00312 this every time.
00313 The first four are the analogue channels. Use only those.*/
00314     uint8_t numberChannels = eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)16);
00315     if (numberChannels > 4) numberChannels = 4;
00316     uint8_t channelStart = 2+eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)1);
00317     for (uint8_t channel = 0; channel < numberChannels; channel++)
00318     {
00319 /* Compute the number of averaging iterations. Note that the channel sums
00320 are maintained as 32 bit values so we can average quite aggressively */
00321         uint16_t sampleCount = (1 << adcShift);
00322 /* Fire off the A/D Conversions on both channels as enabled */
00323         uint32_t channelSum = 0;                    /* cumulative sums */
00324         uint16_t adcErrorCount = 0;                 /* Keep track of errored values */
00325         for (uint16_t n = 0; n < sampleCount; ++n)
00326         {
00331             if(adcStart(_BV(channel)))
00332             {
00333                 int adcValue = 0;
00334                 do
00335                 {
00336                     taskRelinquish();
00337                     adcValue = adcRead(channel);      /* Check if finished and grab result */
00338                 }
00339                 while (adcValue < 0);
00340                 uint16_t channelLastValue = adcValue;
00341                 channelSum += channelLastValue;
00342                 if (adcErrorCount > 0)
00343                 {
00344                     for (uint8_t i = 0; i < adcErrorCount; ++i)
00345                         channelSum += channelLastValue;
00346                     adcErrorCount = 0;
00347                 }
00348             }
00349             else adcErrorCount++;
00350         }
00352         channelValue[channel] = (channelSum >> adcShift);
00354         long channelMulScale = eeprom_read_word((uint16_t *)(channelStart+6));
00355         long channelOffScale = eeprom_read_word((uint16_t *)(channelStart+8));
00356         scaledChannelValue[channel] = rescale(channelValue[channel],channelMulScale,channelOffScale);
00357 /* Find the next channel information block. */
00358         channelStart = channelStart+eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)(channelStart+0))+1;
00359     }
00360 
00361 /* Reschedule the control task and quit */
00362     taskSchedule(controlTaskID,FALSE);
00363     taskExit();
00364 }
00365 
00366 /****************************************************************************/
00379 void controlTask(void)
00380 {
00381 //    for (;;)
00382     {
00383 /* Start the measurement task and wait until it reschedules us. */
00384         measurementTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*measurementTask,FALSE);
00385         taskWait();
00386 
00387 /* Float charging - if the voltage is below the threshold, open the panel
00388 to charge, otherwise short the panel until the voltage drops. */
00389         uint16_t floatThreshold = 8847;                      /* Float charge voltage 13.5V */
00390         uint16_t currentBatteryVoltage = scaledChannelValue[1];
00391         if (currentBatteryVoltage < floatThreshold)
00392             openPanel();
00393         else
00394             shortPanel();
00395 /* The task can get too busy, so give a 100ms gap to allow other tasks to run */
00396         taskExit();
00397     }
00398 }
00399 
00400 /****************************************************************************/
00410 void displayTask(void)
00411 {
00415     if (eepromEnd - bufferEndPointer > DATA_BLOCK_SIZE)
00416         newBufferEndPointer = bufferEndPointer + DATA_BLOCK_SIZE;
00417     else
00418         newBufferEndPointer = BUFFER_START + DATA_BLOCK_SIZE;
00419 /* If full, move the buffer start pointer along one to allow the new value to
00420 overwrite the oldest value */
00421     if (newBufferEndPointer == bufferStartPointer)
00422     {
00423         if (eepromEnd - bufferStartPointer > DATA_BLOCK_SIZE)
00424             bufferStartPointer += DATA_BLOCK_SIZE;
00425         else
00426             bufferStartPointer = BUFFER_START;
00427     }
00428 /* Now write the new pointers so that data can be recovered from the EEPROM
00429 in the event of a power loss.*/
00430     while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00431     saveDelayCounter = 2;
00432     taskWait();                             /* Wait for timer ISR */
00433     twiSetupTransaction(0);                 /* Write only */
00434     twiWriteByte(0x00);                     /* Address of pointers */
00435     twiWriteByte(0x08);
00436     twiWriteByte(low(bufferStartPointer));
00437     twiWriteByte(high(bufferStartPointer));
00438     twiWriteByte(low(newBufferEndPointer));
00439     twiWriteByte(high(newBufferEndPointer));
00440     twiLaunch(localEEPROMDevice);
00441 /* Write the conversion time and all relevant data to EEPROM */
00442     while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00443     saveDelayCounter = 2;
00444     taskWait();                             /* Wait for timer ISR */
00445     twiSetupTransaction(0);                 /* Write only */
00446     twiWriteByte(high(bufferEndPointer));   /* Address */
00447     twiWriteByte(low(bufferEndPointer));
00448     for (uint8_t n = 0; n < 4; ++n)
00449         twiWriteByte(time.timeByte[n]);
00450     for (uint8_t n = 0; n < 4; ++n)         /* Write scaled conversions */
00451     {
00452         twiWriteByte(low(scaledChannelValue[n]));
00453         twiWriteByte(high(scaledChannelValue[n]));
00454     }
00455     twiLaunch(localEEPROMDevice);
00456     bufferEndPointer = newBufferEndPointer;
00457 
00458 /* Multiply, scale back 10 bits and add offset to get a decimal representation.*/
00459 /* Display on LCD Panel */
00460 //    LCDClear();
00461     LCDWriteString("Panel   = ");
00462     display(scaledChannelValue[0]);
00463     LCDWriteString("V");
00464     LCDGotoXY(0,1);                         /* Next Line */
00465     LCDWriteString("Battery = ");
00466     display(scaledChannelValue[1]);
00467     LCDWriteString("V");
00468     LCDGotoXY(0,0);                         /* First Line */
00469     taskExit();
00470 }
00471 
00472 /****************************************************************************/
00487 void processError(void)
00488 {
00489     while (outputBusy) taskRelinquish();
00490     outputCommand = ERROR_COMMAND;
00491     outputBuffer[0] = lastError;
00492     ++numberOutBytes;
00493     lastError = NO_ERROR;
00494     outputPacketSendID = taskStart((uint16_t)*outputPacketSend,FALSE);
00495     taskSchedule(inputPacketReceiveID,FALSE);
00496     taskExit();
00497 }
00498 
00499 /****************************************************************************/
00511 void processCommand(void)
00512 {
00513     while (outputBusy) taskRelinquish();
00514     numberOutBytes = 0;
00515     switch (inputCommand)
00516     {
00517 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00523         case UNIT_INF_ACCESS:
00524         {
00525             if (numberInBytes != 0) lastError = UNIT_INF_ACCESS_SYNTAX;
00526             else
00527             {
00528                 numberOutBytes = 7;
00529                 outputBuffer[0] = low(INF_BLOCK_START);
00530                 outputBuffer[1] = high(INF_BLOCK_START);
00531                 while (! eeprom_is_ready()) taskRelinquish();
00532                 outputBuffer[2] = eeprom_read_byte(INF_BLOCK_START);
00533                 outputBuffer[3] = DATA_BUFFER_SIZE;
00534                 outputBuffer[4] = 0;    /* This would be the Board ID */
00535                 outputBuffer[5] = low(F_CPU/1000);
00536                 outputBuffer[6] = high(F_CPU/1000);
00537                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND;
00538             }
00539         }
00540         break;
00541 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00547         case READ_MEMORY:
00548         {
00549             if (numberInBytes != 3) lastError = READ_MEMORY_SYNTAX;
00550             else
00551             {
00552                 address = (uint8_t *) (inputBuffer[0] + (inputBuffer[1] << 8));
00553                 eepromCount = inputBuffer[2];
00554                 if (eepromCount > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
00555                     eepromCount = DATA_BUFFER_SIZE;
00556                 while (numberOutBytes < eepromCount)
00557                 {
00558                     if (eeprom_is_ready())
00559                     {
00560                         outputBuffer[numberOutBytes] = eeprom_read_byte(address);
00561                         ++numberOutBytes;
00562                         ++address;
00563                     }
00564                     else taskRelinquish();
00565                 }
00566                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND;
00567               }
00568         }
00569         break;
00570 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00576         case WRITE_MEMORY:
00577         {
00578             if ((numberInBytes < 3) || (numberInBytes > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE))
00579                 lastError = WRITE_MEMORY_SYNTAX;
00580             else
00581             {
00582                 uint8_t *address;
00583                 address = (uint8_t *) (inputBuffer[0] + (inputBuffer[1] << 8));
00584                 eepromCount = 2;
00585                 while (eepromCount < numberInBytes)
00586                 {
00587                     if (eeprom_is_ready())
00588                     {
00589                         eeprom_write_byte(address,inputBuffer[eepromCount]);
00590                         ++eepromCount;
00591                         ++address;
00592                     }
00593                     else taskRelinquish();
00594                 }
00595                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00596             }
00597         }
00598         break;
00599 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00606         case READ_EEPROM:
00607         {
00608             if (numberInBytes != 4) lastError = READ_EEPROM_SYNTAX;
00609             else
00610             {                                   /* wait till not busy */
00611                 while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00612                 eepromCount = inputBuffer[3];     /* number of bytes */
00613                 twiSetupTransaction(eepromCount); /* Write/Read */
00614                 twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[2]);     /* High address */
00615                 twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[1]);     /* Low address */
00616                 if (eepromCount > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
00617                     eepromCount = DATA_BUFFER_SIZE;
00618 /* Try to launch the read. If there is a problem, drop out */
00619                 if(twiLaunch(inputBuffer[0]))    /* device ID */
00620                 {
00621 /* The twiCompletionStatus shows if the transaction is busy and also how many
00622 bytes were read if an aborted transaction occurred. First wait until not busy.*/
00623                     while (twiCompletionStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00624                     uint8_t completionStatus = twiCompletionStatus();
00625                     {
00626                         uint8_t numberRead = eepromCount;
00627                         if (completionStatus != 0) numberRead = (completionStatus & 0x3F);
00628                         for (;numberRead > 0; --numberRead)
00629                         {
00630                             outputBuffer[numberOutBytes] = twiReadByte();
00631                             ++numberOutBytes;
00632                         }
00633                         if ((twiErrorStatus() == 0) && (completionStatus == 0))
00634                             outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00635                         else
00636                             lastError = READ_EEPROM_FAIL;
00637                     }
00638                 }
00639                 else
00640                     lastError = READ_EEPROM_FAIL;
00641                 if (lastError == READ_EEPROM_FAIL)
00642                 {
00643                     outputBuffer[1] = twiErrorStatus();
00644                     outputBuffer[2] = twiCompletionStatus();
00645                     numberOutBytes = 2;
00646                 }
00647             }
00648         }
00649         break;
00650 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00656         case WRITE_EEPROM:
00657         {
00658           if ((numberInBytes < 4) || (numberInBytes > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE))
00659             lastError = WRITE_EEPROM_SYNTAX;
00660           else
00661           {
00662             while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00663             eepromCount = 3;                /* count of data bytes */
00664             twiSetupTransaction(0);         /* Write only */
00665             twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[2]);   /* High address */
00666             twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[1]);   /* Low address */
00667             while(eepromCount < numberInBytes)
00668             {
00669               if (! twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[eepromCount])) break;
00670               ++eepromCount;
00671             }
00672 /* Try to launch the write. If there is a problem, drop out */
00673             if (twiLaunch(inputBuffer[0]))  /* device number */
00674             {
00675               while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00676               uint8_t lastTwiError = twiErrorStatus();
00677               if (lastTwiError == 0)
00678                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00679               else
00680                 lastError = WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL;
00681             }
00682             else
00683               lastError = WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL;
00684             if (lastError == WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL)
00685             {
00686               outputBuffer[1] = twiErrorStatus();
00687               outputBuffer[2] = twiCompletionStatus();
00688               numberOutBytes = 2;
00689             }
00690           }
00691         }
00692         break;
00693 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00699         case ADC_ONCE:
00700         {
00701             numberOutBytes = 1;
00702             if (numberInBytes != 2) lastError = ADC_SYNTAX;
00703             else
00704             {
00705                 adcChannel = inputBuffer[0];
00706                 uint8_t adcGain = inputBuffer[1];/* For this application, this is a dummy */
00707                 uint8_t adcStatus = adcStart(1 << adcChannel); /* Start Conversion */
00708                 if (! adcStatus)                /* Check if the start was successful*/
00709                 {
00710                     lastError = ADC_FAILURE;
00711                     outputBuffer[1] = adcStatus;
00712                 }
00713                 else
00714                 {
00715                     while (adcIsBusy()) taskRelinquish(); /* Wait for conversion to end */
00716                     outputBuffer[0] = timer0Read(); /* Timer current value */
00717                     for (uint8_t n=0;n<3;++n)
00718                     {
00719                         outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = time.timeByte[n];
00720                     }
00721                     int adcValue = adcRead(adcChannel);
00722                     outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = low(adcValue);
00723                     outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = high(adcValue);
00724                     outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00725                 }
00726             }
00727         }
00728         break;
00729 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00738         case STATE_VARIABLES:
00739         {
00740             if ((numberInBytes != 1) || (inputBuffer[0] != 0)) lastError = STATE_VARIABLE_SYNTAX;
00741             else
00742             {
00743                 for (uint8_t channel = 0; channel < 4; channel++)
00744                 {
00745                     outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = low(channelValue[channel]);
00746                     outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = high(channelValue[channel]);
00747                 }
00748                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND;
00749             }
00750         }
00751         break;
00752 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00762         case RESET_BUFFER_POINTERS:
00763         {
00764             if (numberInBytes != 0) lastError = RESET_BUFFER_POINTERS_SYNTAX;
00765             else
00766             {
00767                 numberOutBytes = 4;
00768                 outputBuffer[0] = low(bufferStartPointer);
00769                 outputBuffer[1] = high(bufferStartPointer);
00770                 outputBuffer[2] = low(bufferEndPointer);
00771                 outputBuffer[3] = high(bufferEndPointer);
00772                 bufferStartPointer = bufferEndPointer;
00773                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00774             }
00775         }
00776         break;
00777 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00781         case RESET_CLOCK:
00782         {
00783             if (numberInBytes != 0) lastError = RESET_CLOCK_SYNTAX;
00784             else
00785             {
00786                 time.timeValue = 0;
00787                 timer0Init(0,rtcScale);
00788                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00789             }
00790         }
00791         break;
00792 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00803         case BOOTLOADER_JUMP:
00804         {
00805           if (numberInBytes != 0) lastError = BOOT_SYNTAX;
00806           else
00807           {
00808             MCUSR = 0;
00809             WDTCSR = (1 << WDCE) | (1 << WDE);
00810             WDTCSR = (1 << WDE);
00811             outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00812           }
00813         }
00814         break;
00815 #ifdef CORE_DEBUG
00816 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00822         case READ_SRAM:
00823         {
00824           if (numberInBytes != 3) lastError = READ_SRAM_SYNTAX;
00825           else
00826           {
00827             address =(uint8_t *) (inputBuffer[0] + (inputBuffer[1] << 8));
00828             uint8_t count = inputBuffer[2];
00829             if (count > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
00830               count = DATA_BUFFER_SIZE;
00831             while (numberOutBytes < count)
00832             {
00833               outputBuffer[numberOutBytes] = *address;
00834               ++numberOutBytes;
00835               ++address;
00836             }
00837             outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00838           }
00839         }
00840         break;
00841 /* End of CORE_DEBUG section */
00842 #endif
00843 #ifdef DEBUG
00844 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00852         case SET_PORT_BIT:
00853         {
00854           if (numberInBytes != 1) lastError = READ_PORT_SYNTAX;
00855           else
00856           {
00857             uint8_t portBit = inputBuffer[0];
00858             uint8_t port = portBit & 0x0F;
00859             uint8_t bit = portBit >> 4;
00860             if (bit > 7) port = portBit;  /* fudge - drop through to default */
00861             switch (port)
00862             {
00863 #if defined PORTA
00864             case 0x0a: sbi(PORTA,bit); break;
00865 #endif
00866 #if defined PORTB
00867             case 0x0b: sbi(PORTB,bit); break;
00868 #endif
00869 #if defined PORTC
00870             case 0x0c: sbi(PORTC,bit); break;
00871 #endif
00872 #if defined PORTD
00873             case 0x0d: sbi(PORTD,bit); break;
00874 #endif
00875 #if defined PORTE
00876             case 0x0e: sbi(PORTE,bit); break;
00877 #endif
00878 #if defined PORTF
00879             case 0x0f: sbi(PORTF,bit); break;
00880 #endif
00881             default:
00882               lastError = NO_PORT;
00883               numberOutBytes = 1;
00884               outputBuffer[1] = portBit;
00885               break;
00886             }
00887             if (lastError == NO_ERROR)
00888               outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00889           }
00890         }
00891         break;
00892 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00900     case CLEAR_PORT_BIT:
00901     {
00902       if (numberInBytes != 1) lastError = READ_PORT_SYNTAX;
00903       else
00904       {
00905         uint8_t portBit = inputBuffer[0];
00906         uint8_t port = portBit & 0x0F;
00907         uint8_t bit = portBit >> 4;
00908         if (bit > 7) port = portBit;  /* fudge - drop through to default */
00909         switch (port)
00910         {
00911 #if defined PORTA
00912         case 0x0a: cbi(PORTA,bit); break;
00913 #endif
00914 #if defined PORTB
00915         case 0x0b: cbi(PORTB,bit); break;
00916 #endif
00917 #if defined PORTC
00918         case 0x0c: cbi(PORTC,bit); break;
00919 #endif
00920 #if defined PORTD
00921         case 0x0d: cbi(PORTD,bit); break;
00922 #endif
00923 #if defined PORTE
00924         case 0x0e: cbi(PORTE,bit); break;
00925 #endif
00926 #if defined PORTF
00927         case 0x0f: cbi(PORTF,bit); break;
00928 #endif
00929         default:
00930           lastError = NO_PORT;
00931           numberOutBytes = 1;
00932           outputBuffer[1] = portBit;
00933           break;
00934         }
00935         if (lastError == NO_ERROR)
00936           outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00937       }
00938     }
00939     break;
00940 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00945     case READ_PORT:
00946     {
00947       if (numberInBytes != 1) lastError = READ_PORT_SYNTAX;
00948       else
00949       {
00950         uint8_t port = inputBuffer[0];
00951         uint8_t portContents = 0;
00952         numberOutBytes = 1;
00953         switch (port)
00954         {
00955 #if defined PINA
00956         case 0x0a: portContents = inb(PINA); break;
00957 #endif
00958 #if defined PINB
00959         case 0x0b: portContents = inb(PINB); break;
00960 #endif
00961 #if defined PINC
00962         case 0x0c: portContents = inb(PINC); break;
00963 #endif
00964 #if defined PIND
00965         case 0x0d: portContents = inb(PIND); break;
00966 #endif
00967 #if defined PINE
00968         case 0x0e: portContents = inb(PINE); break;
00969 #endif
00970 #if defined PINF
00971         case 0x0f: portContents = inb(PINF); break;
00972 #endif
00973         default:
00974           lastError = NO_PORT;
00975           outputBuffer[1] = port;
00976           break;
00977         }
00978         if (lastError == NO_ERROR)
00979         {
00980           outputBuffer[0] = portContents;
00981           outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00982         }
00983       }
00984     }
00985     break;
00986 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00987 /* End of DEBUG section */
00988 #endif
00989 
00992     default:
00993       lastError = UNKNOWN_COMMAND;
00994     break;
00995   }
00998   if (lastError == NO_ERROR)
00999     outputPacketSendID = taskStart((uint16_t)*outputPacketSend,FALSE);
01000   else
01001     outputPacketSendID = taskStart((uint16_t)*processError,FALSE);
01002   taskSchedule(inputPacketReceiveID,FALSE);
01003   taskExit();
01004 }
01005 
01006 /****************************************************************************/
01029 void inputPacketReceive(void)
01030 {
01031   for(;;)
01032   {
01033     uartInput = uart_getc();  /* upper byte has an error code, if any */
01034     if (high(uartInput) != 0) /* nonzero if error or no character received */
01035       taskRelinquish();
01036     else
01037     {
01038       uint8_t newCharacter = (uint8_t) uartInput & 0xFF;  /* lower byte */
01039       switch (packetInState)
01040       {
01046       case IDLE:                  /* loop until an idle char is received */
01047         if (newCharacter == IDLE_CHAR)
01048         {                         /* get here with a valid IDLE received */
01049           if (! outputBusy) uart_putc(IDLE_CHAR);  /* ping PC */
01050           packetInState = SYNC;   /* look for a sync character */
01051         }
01052         break;
01056       case SYNC:
01057         if (newCharacter == SYNC_CHAR) packetInState = ADDRESS;
01058         else if (newCharacter != IDLE_CHAR) packetInState =IDLE;
01059         else if (! outputBusy) uart_putc(IDLE_CHAR);  /* ping PC */
01060         break;
01064       case ADDRESS:
01065         packetInState = NUMBER_BYTES;
01066         break;
01069       case NUMBER_BYTES:
01070         numberInBytes = newCharacter;
01071         dataInByteCount = 0;      /* counter for data phase */
01072         if (numberInBytes == 0) packetInState = CHECKSUM;
01073         else packetInState = COMMAND;
01074         break;
01077       case COMMAND:
01078         inputCommand = newCharacter;
01079         if (--numberInBytes == 0) packetInState = CHECKSUM;
01080         else packetInState = DATA_PHASE;
01081         break;
01084       case DATA_PHASE:
01085         if (dataInByteCount < DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
01086         {
01087           inputBuffer[dataInByteCount] = newCharacter;
01088         }
01089         if (++dataInByteCount == numberInBytes) packetInState = CHECKSUM;
01090         break;
01092       case CHECKSUM:
01093         packetInState = EOM;
01094         break;
01098       case EOM:
01099         packetInState = IDLE;
01100         if (newCharacter != EOM_CHAR)
01101         {
01102           lastError = COMMAND_SYNTAX;
01103           outputBuffer[1] = newCharacter;
01104           numberOutBytes = 1;
01105           processErrorID = taskStart((uint16_t)*processError,FALSE);
01106         }
01107         else
01108           processCommandID = taskStart((uint16_t)*processCommand,FALSE);
01109         taskWait();
01110         break;
01111       }
01112     }
01113   }
01114 }
01115 
01116 /****************************************************************************/
01128 void outputPacketSend(void)
01129 {
01130   outputBusy = TRUE;
01131   for(;;)         // Loop "indefinitely" but will exit when finished
01132   {
01133     if (! uart_output_free()) taskRelinquish();
01134     else
01135     {
01136       switch (packetOutState)
01137       {
01138       case IDLE:
01139         uart_putc(IDLE_CHAR);
01140         packetOutState = SYNC;
01141         break;
01142       case SYNC:
01143         uart_putc(SYNC_CHAR);
01144         packetOutState = ADDRESS;
01145         checkSum = 0;
01146         break;
01147       case ADDRESS:
01148         uart_putc(0x0);             /* Address is PC, packet type 0 */
01149         packetOutState = NUMBER_BYTES;
01150         break;
01151       case NUMBER_BYTES:
01152         uart_putc(numberOutBytes+1);
01153         checkSum += numberOutBytes+1;
01154         packetOutState = COMMAND;
01155         break;
01156       case COMMAND:
01157         uart_putc(outputCommand);
01158         checkSum += outputCommand;
01159         dataOutByteCount = 0;
01160         packetOutState = DATA_PHASE;
01161         break;
01162       case DATA_PHASE:
01163         if (numberOutBytes-- > 0)
01164         {
01165           uart_putc(outputBuffer[dataOutByteCount]);
01166           checkSum += outputBuffer[dataOutByteCount];
01167           ++dataOutByteCount;
01168         }
01169         else packetOutState = CHECKSUM;
01170         break;
01171       case CHECKSUM:
01172         uart_putc(checkSum);
01173         packetOutState = EOM;
01174         break;
01175       case EOM:
01176         uart_putc(EOM_CHAR);
01177         packetOutState = IDLE;
01178         outputCommand = NO_COMMAND;
01179         numberOutBytes = 0;
01180         outputBusy = FALSE;
01181         taskExit();
01182         break;
01183       }
01184     }
01185   }
01186 }
01187 
01188 /****************************************************************************/
01199 ISR(SIG_OVERFLOW0)
01200 {
01201     time.timeValue++;
01202 /* This counter is used to restart a task at precisely timed intervals.
01203 Set the counter just before starting the task for the first time, then
01204 issue a taskExit at the end of the task. The task should complete well
01205 before the time interval is finished */
01206     if ((displayTaskCounter > 0) && (--displayTaskCounter == 0))
01207     {
01208         displayTaskCounter = displayInterval;   /* Reset counter for next cycle*/
01209         displayTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*displayTask,TRUE);
01210     }
01211     if ((controlTaskCounter > 0) && (--controlTaskCounter == 0))
01212     {
01213         controlTaskCounter = controlInterval;   /* Reset counter for next cycle*/
01214         controlTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*controlTask,TRUE);
01215     }
01216 /* This counter is used within the task to enter a timed wait state.
01217 Set the counter just before the taskWait command. */
01218     if ((controlDelayCounter > 0) && (--controlDelayCounter == 0))
01219     {
01220         taskSchedule(controlTaskID,TRUE);
01221     }
01222     if ((saveDelayCounter > 0) && (--saveDelayCounter == 0))
01223     {
01224         taskSchedule(displayTaskID,TRUE);
01225     }
01226 }
01227 
01228 /****************************************************************************/
01237 long rescale(const int quantity,const int multiplier,const int offset)
01238 {
01239     uint16_t q = quantity;
01240     if (quantity < 0) q = -quantity;
01241     uint16_t m = multiplier;
01242     if (multiplier < 0) m = -multiplier;
01243     uint16_t o = offset;
01244     if (offset < 0) o = -offset;
01245     uint8_t lowVoltage = low(q);
01246     uint8_t highVoltage = high(q);
01247     uint8_t lowMultiplier = low(m);
01248     uint8_t highMultiplier = high(m);
01249     uint16_t first = lowVoltage*lowMultiplier;
01250     uint16_t second = lowVoltage*highMultiplier+ highVoltage*lowMultiplier;
01251     uint16_t third = highVoltage*highMultiplier;
01252     int product = ((high(first) + second) >> 2) + (third << 6);
01253     if (((quantity>0) && (multiplier<0)) || ((quantity<0) && (multiplier>0))) product = -product;
01254     if (offset>0) return product+o;
01255     else return product-o;
01256 }
01257 /****************************************************************************/
01266 void display(const long value)
01267 {
01268     uint32_t v = value;
01269     if (value < 0)
01270     {
01271         v = -value;
01272         LCDByte(1,'-');
01273     }
01274     uint8_t precision = 4;
01275     for (uint8_t n = 0; n<precision; n++)
01276     {
01277         uint32_t x = v*10;
01278         uint8_t digit = (x >> 16);
01279         v = x - ((uint32_t)digit << 16);
01280         if ((n > 0) || (digit > 0)) LCDByte(1,digit+48);
01281         if (n == 1) LCDByte(1,'.');
01282     }
01283 }
01284 
01285 /****************************************************************************/
01293 void setErrorCode(const unsigned int code)
01294 {
01295     if (code == 0)
01296         offLED();
01297     else
01298     {
01299         onLED();
01300         LCDClear();
01301         LCDWriteString("Error Code: ");
01302         LCDWriteHexWord((unsigned int)code,0);
01303     }
01304 }
01305 
01306 /****************************************************************************/
01313 /****************************************************************************/
01325 void configurePorts(void)
01326 {
01327 /* Set PortD DDR bits 2-7 to outputs for LCD. Bits 0,1 are the USART ports */
01328     outb(DDRD,(inb(DDRD) | 0xFC));
01329 /* Set PORTB as outputs on bits 0-2 to set controls */
01330     outb(DDRB,(inb(DDRB) | 0x07));
01331 /* Set all four ADC port pins (analogue inputs) as inputs */
01332     outb(DDRC,(inb(DDRC) & 0xF0));
01333     outb(PRR,0x4D);                   /* power down unused peripherals */
01334     sbi(ACSR,7);                      /* Turn off Analogue Comparator */
01335 }
01336 /****************************************************************************/
01340 void openPanel(void)
01341 {
01342     sbi(PORTB,0);                     // Panel is not shorted
01343 }
01344 /****************************************************************************/
01348 void shortPanel(void)
01349 {
01350     cbi(PORTB,0);                     // Panel is shorted
01351 }
01352 /****************************************************************************/
01356 void connectLoad(void)
01357 {
01358     cbi(PORTB,1);                     // Load is connected
01359 }
01360 /****************************************************************************/
01364 void isolateLoad(void)
01365 {
01366     sbi(PORTB,1);                     // Load is connected
01367 }
01368 /****************************************************************************/
01372 void onLED(void)
01373 {
01374     cbi(PORTB,2);                     // Load is connected
01375 }
01376 /****************************************************************************/
01380 void offLED(void)
01381 {
01382     sbi(PORTB,2);                     // Load is connected
01383 }
